metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38209 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_standalone.c in the Linux kernel before 5.12.2allows observation of changes in any net namespace because these changesare leaked into all other net namespaces. This is related to theNF_SYSCTL_CT_MAX, NF_SYSCTL_CT_EXPECT_MAX, and NF_SYSCTL_CT_BUCKETSsysctls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-59-generic - 5.8.0-59.66~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-9.12').
